backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor for the exam paper generation system, defining data types and CRUD operations for subjects, questions, generated papers, and user profiles with role-based access control via AccessControl and MixinAuthorization mixins.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report declaring that the frontend codebase was reverted to its Version 13 state, listing all affected frontend files and associated components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing one-line summaries of each frontend source file, describing the purpose and notable changes made to each page, component, hook, and utility.
frontend/index.css: Global CSS file that sets up Tailwind base/components/utilities and defines CSS custom properties for light and dark theme color tokens including background, foreground, primary, sidebar, and chart colors.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point for the React app, mounting the root div and loading the main TypeScript module for the Automatic Question Paper Generation System.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that sets up TanStack Query and TanStack Router with an auth-guarded layout, defining all application routes including dashboard, question bank, paper generation, and preview pages.
frontend/src/components/EditQuestionModa: Dialog modal component for editing an existing question, with form fields for text, category, difficulty, and MCQ options, using the useUpdateQuestion mutation hook.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Sidebar layout component with navy-blue theme, navigation links with icons, user principal display, and logout functionality wrapping page content.
frontend/src/components/PaperCard.tsx: Displays a summary card for a generated exam paper showing subject name, date, duration, and marks, with a button to navigate to the paper preview page.
frontend/src/components/PaperSection.tsx: Renders a section of an exam paper with a title, numbered questions, marks per question, and MCQ options displayed in a grid layout.
frontend/src/components/QuestionCard.tsx: Displays a single question with its category, difficulty, and optional MCQ options, along with edit and delete action buttons.
frontend/src/components/StatsCard.tsx: A simple presentational card component that shows a statistic with an icon, title, and count using a gradient background.
frontend/src/components/SubjectManager.t: Provides a full CRUD UI for managing subjects, including add/edit forms and delete confirmation dialogs backed by React Query mutations.
Renders a horizontal step-by-step workflow diagram illustrating the five-step process from adding subjects to downloading PDF exam papers.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous ICP backend actor using React Query, reinitializing and invalidating dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements an Internet Identity authentication context provider and hook using DFINITY's AuthClient, exposing login, logout, and identity state to the React component tree.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for all backend data operations including CRUD for subjects, questions (including bulk upload), and generated papers.
frontend/src/index.css: Global CSS file that imports Poppins and Inter fonts, sets up Tailwind directives, and defines CSS custom properties for a navy-blue academic theme including light/dark mode tokens and utility classes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: React app entry point that wraps the App component with TanStack QueryClientProvider and a custom InternetIdentityProvider before mounting to the DOM.
frontend/src/pages/AddQuestion.tsx: Page component for adding exam questions individually or via bulk CSV/JSON upload, with form validation, file parsing, preview, and submission to the backend.
frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx: Main dashboard page displaying a welcome banner, stats cards for subjects/questions/papers, a workflow diagram, and a list of recently generated papers.
frontend/src/pages/GeneratedPapers.tsx: Page that lists all previously generated exam papers sorted by creation date, with loading and empty states, and a button to navigate to paper generation.
frontend/src/pages/GeneratePaper.tsx: Page component for configuring and generating an exam paper by selecting a subject and specifying question counts per category, with availability validation before submission.
frontend/src/pages/Login.tsx: Login page featuring a branding panel with feature highlights and an Internet Identity sign-in button for authenticating teachers into the ExamCraft platform.
frontend/src/pages/PaperPreview.tsx: Renders a preview page for a generated exam paper, grouping questions by category into sections, supporting variant selection, and providing a PDF download button.
frontend/src/pages/QuestionBank.tsx: Displays a tabbed interface for browsing/filtering questions and managing subjects, with search and filter controls for category, difficulty, and subject.
frontend/src/utils/csvParser.ts: Parses CSV text into structured question objects, validating required fields, category/difficulty mappings, and marks consistency, returning parsed questions and errors.
frontend/src/utils/csvTemplate.ts: Generates and triggers a browser download of a sample CSV template file with example question rows for bulk import.
frontend/src/utils/docxParser.ts: Empty file with no implemented content.
frontend/src/utils/docxTemplate.ts: Empty file with no implemented content.
frontend/src/utils/jsonParser.ts: Parses a JSON array of question objects, validates required fields and enum values, and returns typed Question objects along with any validation errors.
frontend/src/utils/pdfGenerator.ts: Generates a printable HTML exam paper document from structured section/question data and opens it in a new window for PDF printing.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides utility functions for reading URL query parameters (including hash-based routing), persisting them in sessionStorage, and cleaning sensitive params from the URL.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration for the frontend, enabling dark mode via class, defining custom fonts (Inter, Poppins), a full design-token-based color palette (oklch/hsl CSS variables), custom border radii, box shadows, and keyframe animations.
project_state.json: Tracks the ExamCraft project state at schema version 1.0.0, recording one completed frontend revert feature (to Version 13) and one pending backend revert request (AR-2) covering the Motoko actor, data types, and access control.
